summary:
Major depressive disorder (MDD) is a serious mental health condition. It makes people feel sad, lose interest in things they enjoy, and have low self-worth. This disorder can last for weeks, months, or even years. MDD starts mostly in a person's 20s and affects women more than men.

Doctors diagnose it by talking to the person and their loved ones. Treatment includes therapy, medicine, or sometimes electric shocks to the brain (ECT). The cause is often a mix of genes, life events, and personality traits. It can impact a person's daily life and health.
title: Major depressive disorder
